Description: Foot and body sherd of Corinthian black-glazed pottery kotyle; interior glazed (fired red); exterior: from top, glazed area with red and white added bands; at base rays and a vertical squiggle; black on outer edge of foot; large black band on underside and possible traces of a second.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 99, no. A144)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.247) (phase 3)
